page.title: 05HISTORICAL BUILDINGS
page.content: There are some fine{Georgian buildings which were originally built around this busy 18th Century port with it's{trows}and longboats.The basins are now the mooring place for 100's of{pleasure craft}still over looked by the Canal Company's building-now a public house-The {Tontine. The round house at Areley Kings used to be a working windmill.It was built about 1795 and has given it's to the local first and middle schools.The millers cottage stands beside the mill.The{windmill}itself was made into a dwelling in 1902. The present bridge built in 1870 superceded a 3 arch stone bridge which was built by the canal company in 1775.Prior to this the ferry and ford at{Redstone Caves}was used.It was a toll bridge until 1893.
